trans-unit.source: A py.test run executes both unit and integration tests. The integration tests use mocked sockets to simulate the sending and receiving of commands and responses, and are kept in the test/server/ subdirectory.
trans-unit.target: A py.test run executes both unit and integration tests. The integration tests use mocked sockets to simulate the sending and receiving of commands and responses, and are kept in the test/server/ subdirectory.

trans-unit.source: API Documentation
trans-unit.target: Документация по API

trans-unit.source: Add new messages using the append command:
trans-unit.target: Добавляйте новые сообщения с помощью команды приложения:

trans-unit.source: Adds additional IMAP response codes that can help tell an IMAP client why a command failed.
trans-unit.target: Добавляет дополнительные коды ответа IMAP,которые могут помочь сказать IMAP клиенту,почему команда провалилась.

trans-unit.source: Adds the APPENDLIMIT= capability, declaring the maximum message size a server will accept from an APPEND command. Mailbox-specific limitations defined by the RFC are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Adds the APPENDLIMIT= capability, declaring the maximum message size a server will accept from an APPEND command. Mailbox-specific limitations defined by the RFC are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Adds the BINARY extension, providing better support for the encoding and transfer of binary data.
trans-unit.target: Adds the BINARY extension, providing better support for the encoding and transfer of binary data.

trans-unit.source: Adds the IDLE capability and command, which lets clients wait (without issuing commands) and receive mailbox updates as they happen without polling.
trans-unit.target: Adds the IDLE capability and command, which lets clients wait (without issuing commands) and receive mailbox updates as they happen without polling.

trans-unit.source: Adds the MULTIAPPEND capability, allowing multiple messages to be atomically appended to a mailbox with a single APPEND command.
trans-unit.target: Adds the MULTIAPPEND capability, allowing multiple messages to be atomically appended to a mailbox with a single APPEND command.

trans-unit.source: Adds the OBJECTID capability, assigning unique IDs to mailboxes, messages, and threads to improve client caching and display.
trans-unit.target: Adds the OBJECTID capability, assigning unique IDs to mailboxes, messages, and threads to improve client caching and display.

trans-unit.source: Adds the UIDPLUS capability, which adds the UID EXPUNGE command and defines the APPENDUID and COPYUID giving clients more insight into the messages added to a mailbox.
trans-unit.target: Adds the UIDPLUS capability, which adds the UID EXPUNGE command and defines the APPENDUID and COPYUID giving clients more insight into the messages added to a mailbox.

trans-unit.target: Инструмент администрирования

trans-unit.source: Copyright (c) 2019 Ian Good
trans-unit.target: Авторское право (c)2019 Ян Гуд

trans-unit.source: Defines some conventions for handling multi-access in scenarios such as EXPUNGE and mailbox deletion.
trans-unit.target: Defines some conventions for handling multi-access in scenarios such as EXPUNGE and mailbox deletion.

trans-unit.target: Разработка и тестирование

trans-unit.target: For compatibility with dovecot's auth dict, a JSON object can be used instead of a redis hash with the --users-json command-line argument.

trans-unit.source: In addition to RFC 3501, pymap supports a number of IMAP extensions to give clients easier and more powerful use.
trans-unit.target: In addition to RFC 3501, pymap supports a number of IMAP extensions to give clients easier and more powerful use.

trans-unit.source: In another terminal, connect to port 1143 and run some commands:
trans-unit.target: В другом терминале подключитесь к порту 1143 и выполните некоторые команды:

trans-unit.source: In this example, the eacb1cf1558741d0b5419b3f838882f5 and Fdaddd3075d7b42e78a7edb1d87ee5800 prefixes are randomly generated IDs acting as the namespaces for the login user and mailbox, respectively, and the message has UID 9173.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the eacb1cf1558741d0b5419b3f838882f5 and Fdaddd3075d7b42e78a7edb1d87ee5800 prefixes are randomly generated IDs acting as the namespaces for the login user and mailbox, respectively, and the message has UID 9173 .

trans-unit.source: Install and Usage
trans-unit.target: Установка и использование

trans-unit.source: Keys are composed of a heirarchy of prefixes separated by /. For example, the key containing the flags of a message might be:
trans-unit.target: Keys are composed of a heirarchy of prefixes separated by / . For example, the key containing the flags of a message might be:

trans-unit.source: Lightweight, asynchronous IMAP serving in Python.
trans-unit.target: Легкий,асинхронный IMAP,подаваемый в Питоне.

trans-unit.source: No additional functionality by itself, but allows pymap to be extended easily and more robustly handle bad client implementations.
trans-unit.target: Никакой дополнительной функциональности сам по себе,но позволяет легко расширять пимапу и более надежно работать с плохими клиентскими реализациями.

trans-unit.source: No code contribution will be accepted unless it makes every effort to use type hinting to the extent possible and common in the rest of the codebase. There is no need to attempt --strict mode.
trans-unit.target: No code contribution will be accepted unless it makes every effort to use type hinting to the extent possible and common in the rest of the codebase. There is no need to attempt --strict mode.

trans-unit.source: Once installed, subsequent restarts of the pymap server will listen on port 9090 by default for incoming requests from the admin tool. See the pymap-admin page for more information, and check out the help:
trans-unit.target: Once installed, subsequent restarts of the pymap server will listen on port 9090 by default for incoming requests from the admin tool. See the pymap-admin page for more information, and check out the help:

trans-unit.source: Once started, check out the dict plugin example above to connect and see it in action.
trans-unit.target: После запуска,посмотрите пример плагина dict выше,чтобы подключиться и увидеть его в действии.

trans-unit.source: Once started, check out the dict plugin example above to connect and see it in action. The biggest difference is, when stop and restart the pymap server, your mail messages remain intact.
trans-unit.target: После запуска,посмотрите пример плагина dict выше,чтобы подключиться и увидеть его в действии.Самая большая разница заключается в том,что при остановке и перезапуске пимап-сервера ваши почтовые сообщения остаются нетронутыми.

trans-unit.source: The colon-delimited fields are the user ID, the mailbox path, and the password. The mailbox path may be empty, relative, or absolute. An empty mailbox path will use the user ID as a relative path.
trans-unit.target: Поля,разделенные двоеточием,-это идентификатор пользователя,путь к почтовому ящику и пароль.Путь к почтовому ящику может быть пустым,относительным или абсолютным.Пустой путь к почтовому ящику будет использовать идентификатор пользователя в качестве относительного пути.

trans-unit.source: The default way to create logins is with a redis hash with a password field. For example:
trans-unit.target: The default way to create logins is with a redis hash with a password field. For example:

trans-unit.source: The dict plugin uses in-memory dictionary objects to store mail and metadata. While the server is running, all concurrent and future connections will see the same data, including added and removed messages, but no changes will persist if the server is restarted.
trans-unit.target: Плагин dict использует объекты словаря in-memory для хранения почты и метаданных.Во время работы сервера все одновременные и будущие соединения будут видеть одни и те же данные,включая добавленные и удаленные сообщения,но никакие изменения не сохранятся,если сервер будет перезагружен.

trans-unit.source: The maildir plugin uses on-disk storage for mail and metadata. For mail data, it uses the eponymous Maildir format. However, since Maildir alone is not enough for modern IMAP usage, it is extended with additional data as described in Dovecot's MailboxFormat/Maildir, with the intention of being fully compatible.
trans-unit.target: The maildir plugin uses on-disk storage for mail and metadata. For mail data, it uses the eponymous Maildir format. However, since Maildir alone is not enough for modern IMAP usage, it is extended with additional data as described in Dovecot's MailboxFormat/Maildir, with the intention of being fully compatible.

trans-unit.source: The redis plugin uses the Redis data structure store for mail and metadata. It requires aioredis and will not appear in the plugins list without it.
trans-unit.target: The redis plugin uses the Redis data structure store for mail and metadata. It requires aioredis and will not appear in the plugins list without it.

trans-unit.source: This project attempts to simplify the complexity of the IMAP protocol into a set of clean Python APIs that can be implemented by pluggable backends. Everything runs in an asyncio event loop.
trans-unit.target: This project attempts to simplify the complexity of the IMAP protocol into a set of clean Python APIs that can be implemented by pluggable backends. Everything runs in an asyncio event loop.
